summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It informs them that the government is producing FBI-prepared spreadsheets (with embedded photos removed due to child exploitation material) related to evidence on hard drives, and details the protective order markings applied to the production.

events.title: Evidence Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces FBI-prepared spreadsheets (with photos removed) from hard drive evidence to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, governed by a protective order.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential materials.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim, 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI had hard drives containing photo files, and some of those files depicted child exploitation materials.
The prosecution produced modified versions of evidence spreadsheets to the defense, with embedded photographs removed due to the nature of the content.
A specific protective order from July 31, 2020, governs the handling of confidential materials in the Maxwell case, and the production was marked accordingly.
The Department of Justice directed the prosecution to change how 'confidential' materials were marked to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
